HttpHeaders
HttpHeaders

Helper class used for parsing and accessing http headers, or for building headers based on request requirements.

Functions
HttpHeaders
HttpHeaders()

Default constructor. Used to add headers to HttpResponse object.

See Also

HttpResponse

HttpHeaders
explicit HttpHeaders(
std::string &headers
)

Constructor that parses headers from string object. Used when generating HttpRequest object.

Parameters
headers
std::string&

reference to std::string that contains raw headers. IS COMPLETELY DESTROYED AFTER PARSING.

See Also

HttpRequest

addHeader
int addHeader(
std::string &key,
const std::string &value
)

Adds key-value pair as header data to internal std::map structure.

Parameters
key
std::string&

Header name.

value
const std::string&

Header value.

Returns

1 if header with same name was already added. Else 0.

addDateHeader
int addDateHeader()

Adds a header with the date and time the response was generated.

Returns

1 if header with same name was already added. Else 0.

addAllowHeader
int addAllowHeader()

Adds a header with data types that are accepted by the server.

Returns

1 if header with same name was already added. Else 0.

addContentLengthHeader
int addContentLengthHeader(
int length
)

Adds a header with content length.

Parameters
length
int

Length of response body.

Returns

1 if header with same name was already added. Else 0.

closeConnection
int closeConnection()

Adds a header that indicates that connection should be closed.

Returns

1 if header with same name was already added. Else 0.

addCORSHeaders
int addCORSHeaders()

Adds a header that indicates that connection should be closed.

Returns

1 if header with same name was already added. Else 0.

toString
std::string toString() const
Returns

All added headers as std::string formatted to be understood by web browsers.

verbose
void verbose() const
Returns

Headers data as formatted std::string.
